title: Lead, Housekeeping (Night)
content: MAJOR PURPOSE:The Night Housekeeping Lead for the Jackie Robinson Training Complex (JRTC) is responsible for assisting with oversight of the housekeepers/general cleaners during their shifts.  The housekeeping lead will assist with ensuring team members are complying with high standards of cleanliness and sanitation protocol in the hotel rooms and general areas while maintaining quality controls and ensuring superior guest service. RESPONSIBILITIES:Assist Housekeeping Manager with the monitoring of all the daily operations of the housekeeping department, including the cleanliness of all guest rooms and public areas daily.Support Housekeeping Manager by providing leadership oversight to the team and substituting for Housekeeping Manager as needed.Assist with the hiring, training, and scheduling of housekeeping & general cleaning staff.Ensure that SOPs for cleaning of the general areas & rooms are followed and verified to maintain our high expectations for cleanliness.Assist with inventory and ensure there is a stock of adequate cleaning supplies in all areas throughout the facility.Ensure that all safety policies and procedures are enforced in the department.Assist with training staff on safety, standard procedures, and required chemicals in accordance with MSDS.Work closely with Event Services department to ensure the facility is prepared for guests both in the rooms and in general areas. Assist with ensuring areas are cleaned by room attendants and report any issues such as room damage or maintenance requests to the front office.Motivate team members and resolve any issues that occur on the job.Respond to customer complaints and special requests.Participate in large cleaning projects as required.The preferred candidate will have a high school diploma or general equivalency diploma (GED), or one to three months of related experience and/or trainingA minimum of 1 years of customer service experience is preferred.A minimum of 1 year of supervisory experienceExcellent verbal and written communication skills; ability to communicate confidently and effectively with all levels of stakeholders.Self-motivated, highly organized and detail oriented.Must be flexible to adapt quickly to changing priorities and assignments.Ability to use logic and reasoning to identify the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions, conclusions or approaches to problems.Candidate must be a self-starter who will work as a team player and be able to work independently.Ability to work irregular hours including nights, weekends, and holidays.Possession of a valid Driver's License.Ability to lift a minimum of 30 pounds.California Residents: Have you reviewed our California Consumer Privacy Act Policy ?
